meanings.definition: Able to be compensated or paid for
meanings.sent1: The damaged item was compensable and could be replaced.
meanings.sent2: The worker's extra hours were compensable and added to his paycheck.
meanings.sent3: The lost toy was compensable, so the child received a new one.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work was compensable with a bonus at the end of the month.
meanings.sent5: The broken vase was clearly compensable and would be refunded.

meanings.sent1: The injured employee was compensable for his medical expenses.
meanings.sent2: The artist's masterpiece was compensable for its high artistic value.
meanings.sent3: The cat's funny antics were compensable with a treat.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the project was compensable with a promotion.
meanings.sent5: The exceptional service was clearly compensable with a generous tip.
